Class OffScreenDrawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • pc.OffScreenDrawing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class OffScreenDrawing
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    OffScreenDrawing draws the grid for the MissionControlGUI GUI
    Author:
    Corey Short, Phuc Nguyen, Khoa Tran
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • drawRobotPath

        public void drawRobotPath(int xx,
                 int yy,
                 int heading)
        Draws the robot's path during any movement. It is also responsible for drawing the robots pose and painting over its previous pose as the same color as the background
        Parameters:
        xx - - the x-coordinate of the robot
        yy - - the y-coordinate of the robot
        heading - - the current heading of the robot

      • drawPose

        public void drawPose(int x,
            int y,
            int heading,
            java.awt.Color c)
        Draws the pose of the robot as a triangle on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x-coordinate of the robot
        y - - the y-coordinate of the robot
        heading - - the heading of the robot
        c - - the color of the pose to be drawn

            java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a wall for the map left and map right methods.
        Parameters:
        xx - - the x-coordinate of the wall
        yy - - the y-coordinate of the wall
        color - - the color to draw the wall

      • drawStdDev

        public void drawStdDev(int xx,
              int yy,
              int devX,
              int devY)
        Draws the standard deviation as an ellipse around the pose, x, y.
        Parameters:
        xx - - current pose x
        yy - - current pose y
        devX - - current standard deviation of x
        devY - - current standard deviation of y
